hackathon-description-text: We are an international hackathon hosted by and held at Yale, bringing together 1500 hackers and creatives from all over the world.
hackathon-requirements: Submissions must be in by 8:30 am on Sunday. All submissions must be published on Devpost.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1st Place - $3000
2nd Place - $2000
3rd Place - $1000

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Granted to the team that has the best use of the Esri APIs.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Esri Technology - $1000

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of Corsair Gaming SDKs
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Corsair API Prize - Corsair Gear

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hack #1: I can’t believe there’s data in that!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Alteryx - Most Interesting or Creative Use of Analytics

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hack #2: With Great Analytics Comes Great Responsibility
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Alteryx - Most impactful use of Analytics for Good - $1000 to team selected charity

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: REO Property Assessment and Management Service: Create a suite of apps and services to help companies assess and monitor the condition of properties (in this case, single family homes), and to schedule maintenance work on those properties.  The apps should provide functionality for field service agents and for back-office analysts and administrators.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Fannie Mae API Prize - A trip to DC to meet with the Fannie Mae Tech Team
Vitech API Prize - $500 Gift Card (split)
Nasdaq API Prize - Talk with CIO in NYC at MarketSite
Two Sigma Beaker Notebook Prize - $100 Amex gift card for the whole team
Datto Best Use of Encryption - $300 Gift Card

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Must be using Maxim hardware to qualify. $1000 to top 3 teams.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Maxim Integrated Hardware Prize - $1000

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Do Something Cool with Cloud Server API
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1&1 Cloud API Prize -  Samsung Galaxy S7 or Samsung Tablet for every Team Member

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best Use of Medidata's Mobile Health App
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Medidata API Prize - Fitbit Charge 2 per team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best Use of Pitney Bowes API
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Pitney Bowes API Prize - Echo Dot & Phillips Hue bulb per team member and lunch with CIO
Intuit - Google Home

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Demonstrate a strong and conscious effort to shield the investor with knowledge that would protect their wallets and their belief in the integrity of the market. FINRA's mission is to protect investors in the stock market. Any vehicle to effectively accomplish that mission is welcome, with creativity being a driving factor. The challenge is to create something that can be used to educate brokers, dealers, seasoned or fresh investors that is engaging as well as informative.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: FINRA Prize - $1000

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Media--and the way we consume it--has changed drastically since the Golden Age of Television. How do you envision the way you will discover, collect and watch media in 2020? Your challenge is to create a glimpse of the future of media delivery and presentation.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: A+E Challenge - $100 gift card per team member & A+E Swag

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: See their document for more information.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: iRobot Challenge - Roomba for the team
1&1 Secondary Prize -$200
Namecheap - Best Domain Name
Rough Draft Ventures - up to $25k in funding

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Payne Whitney Gymnasium, 70 Tower Pkwy, New Haven, CT 06511, USA
hackathon-location-address: Payne Whitney Gymnasium, 70 Tower Pkwy, New Haven, CT 06511, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How original is your hack? Is this a novel idea or something that's built at every hackathon?
How technically challenging is it? Which technologies did you use?
What impression do you get from the hack? Does it provide for a smooth user experience?
How applicable is your hack to problems we're facing today?
